BlueSport

This is BlueSport, a free
tournament manager for mobile.

  • Tell Me More

BlueSport puts tournament management, stat-tracking, and matchmaking in the hands of every athlete.

Literally. Coming soon for iOS and Android

Created for little leagues, weekend warriors, IMs...and everyone who plays the sport they love

From stat-tracking for the aspiring athlete to recording that season-defining softball win, we want our achievements remembered like those of the pros

  • Find Out More
  • Feature 1
  • Feature 2
  • Feature 3
  • Feature 4
  • Feature 5
  • Feature 6

Tournament Management

Forget poster and sticky notes. Create elimination brackets and round robin playoffs, report match results, and watch the tournament update itself.

Matchmaking

No team? No worries! We'll find you teammates and opponents that fit your skill level, schedule, and playstyle--in any sport.

Stat-tracking

Let our analytics track your performance progression, and how you stack up against the local competition.

Our Team

Lukas Brower

Lukas Brower is from Amsterdam, New York and is a Junior in the Computer Science Department at Princeton University. He enjoys football, golf, and tennis, and is always up for a pick-up game of any kind.

Kenan Farmer

Kenan is a sophomore Princeton University Computer Science concentrator from Atlanta, Georgia. He is a distance track and field athlete and has experience in networks and some mobile applications.

Elise Georis

Elise Georis is a junior in the computer science department at Princeton University, and she currently lives in Seattle. When she's not coding or tutoring, she enjoys running, skiing, and yoga.

Nicole Marvin

Nicole Marvin is a junior from Pawling, New York studying Computer Science. At Princeton University, she competes on the Cross Country team and enjoys all manners of outdoor activities.

Yuan Wang (team manager)

Yuan Wang hails from Los Angeles, California and is currently a junior at Princeton University studying mathematics. He is passionate about youth athletics and is a road cyclist on Princeton's cycling team.

Hansen Zhang (project manager)

Hansen Zhang is the realest baller in Princeton COS department.
